text: - My name is David Gildea.
I'm a VP of Product at Druva,

and I'm specializing in
generative AI technologies.

Generative AI is really just
presenting a huge opportunity

for how customers and companies
interact with their data,

how they use products, and
how they're more productive.
There's a lot of misconceptions,

but the biggest I think
is that generative AI
is like AGI at the moment.
So, it's general intelligence,

when really, you still need
people and talented people
who can get the most out of generative AI,

and that's really one
of the misconceptions.
It can't replace people just yet,

but it can certainly make
you a lot more productive
and help you get a lot more
out of what you do on a daily basis.

As a data resiliency company,
security is number one,

and that comes down to
evaluating every aspect
of generative AI and how we interact

with those generative AI models
to make sure that we have
the best security possible in place.

There's never a chance to
take delivery over security,

but one of the ways we
address our speed to market
is by working with the likes of AWS.
So, for us, Amazon Bedrock makes sure

that we can get to market
as quickly as possible,

but also ensure that
security is still addressed
as the number one concern.
So, Bedrock gives us access to many models

that we can quickly iterate,
try different models,

make sure that they meet
our customers' demands,

but always have security
as the number one concern.

AWS helps Druva be more
innovative and at speed.
We can get to market quicker,

we can get generative AI
products out to our customers

that really impress them and
help them achieve the most
with Druva products,
but do so in the most secure
and best possible way.
(bright subtle music)
